item.title: FULL Webclient Tutorial! [DELTA]
item.description:
@202685 wrote:

[center][size=12pt]This is a tut on how to make a delta webclient![/size][/center]
[center]This is also my first large tutorial of any kind.[/center]

[center][size=18pt]Making Cache Load From C: Drive![/size][/center]

[center]Follow these steps and you should have a working webclient[/center]

[center]Step 1. look at the folders you have at the top of your client files (usually cache, sprites, etc.) keep these folder names in mind.[/center]

[center]Step 2. open up zfile-searcher and search for each of the folder names, and for each one, go into the file and change the path to "C:/CACHENAMEHERRE/FOLDERNAMEHERE" and remember to change “CACHENAMEHERE” to the name you want your cache to be. and change “FOLERNAMEHERE” to the folder you just looked up in zfiles-searcher[/center]

Ex. the sprite file currently loads from the client directory, i want my cache name to be “RuneObsolete” so i would look up “./Sprites” in zfile-searcher, then go into the files it finds “./Sprites” in and change “./Sprites” to “C:/RuneObsolete/Sprites”

[center]So after you change all of that, drag all of the folders you just did into the cache folder and rename it to your “CACHENAMEHERE” then drag it into your C: drive…[/center]

[center]Now go into signlink.java and search “findcachedir” and replace the whole method with this

public static final String findcachedir() { String s; String s1; File file; s = "C:/CACHENAMEHERE/"; s1 = ""; file = new File((new StringBuilder()).append(s1).append(s).toString()); if(file.exists() || file.mkdir()) { return (new StringBuilder()).append(s1).append(s).append("/").toString(); } return null; }
then compile your client and test to see if it loads, if it doesnt, look over your changes for a mistake.[/center]

[center][size=18pt]AutoCacheDownloader![/size][/center]

[center]Step 1. Go into your cache folder (so you can see the contents), highlight everything and add it to a zip archive.[/center]

[center]Step 2. When its done zipping, go to dropbox.com and upload it into your public folder.[/center]

[center]Step 2.5 add these imports to client.java

import java.awt.Dimension; import java.net.URL; import java.net.URLConnection; import java.util.Enumeration; import java.util.zip.ZipEntry; import java.util.zip.ZipFile;[/center]

[center]Step 3. go into client.java and search “class44 method67” and replace the whole method with this

[code=java]public String name;
public String dir;

public void downloadcache(String url, String name1, String dir1, String type)
{
dir = dir1;
name = name1;
try
{
URLConnection connection = (new URL(url)).openConnection();
String f[] = url.split("/");
File file = new File(f[f.length - 1]);
int length = connection.getContentLength();
InputStream instream = connection.getInputStream();
try{new File(signlink.findcachedir()+dir).mkdir();}catch(Exception e){}
FileOutputStream outstream = new FileOutputStream(signlink.findcachedir()+dir+file);
int size = 0;
int copy;
byte[] buffer = new byte[4096];
while((copy = instream.read(buffer)) != -1)
{
outstream.write(buffer, 0, copy);
size+= copy;
int percentage = (int)(((double)size / (double)length) * 100D);
method13(percentage, (byte)4, “Downloading Cache - “+percentage+”%”);
}
if(length != size)
{
instream.close();
outstream.close();
} else
{
method13(5, (byte)4, “Unpacking files…”);
instream.close();
outstream.close();
unZipFile();
deleteFile();
method13(10, (byte)4, “Unpacking was complete”);
}
}
catch(Exception e)
{
System.err.println(“Error connecting to server.”);
e.printStackTrace();
}
}
public void writeStream(InputStream In, OutputStream Out) throws IOException
{
byte Buffer[] = new byte[4096];
int Len;
while((Len = In.read(Buffer)) >= 0)
{
Out.write(Buffer, 0, Len);
}
In.close();
Out.close();
}

public void unZipFile()
{
    try
    {
        ZipFile ZipFile = new ZipFile(signlink.findcachedir()+dir+name);
        for(Enumeration Entries = ZipFile.entries(); Entries.hasMoreElements();)
        {
            ZipEntry Entry = (ZipEntry)Entries.nextElement();
            if(Entry.isDirectory())
            {
                (new File(signlink.findcachedir()+dir+Entry.getName())).mkdir();
            } else
            {
                writeStream(ZipFile.getInputStream(Entry), new BufferedOutputStream(new FileOutputStream(signlink.findcachedir()+dir+Entry.getName())));
            }
        }
        ZipFile.close();
    }
    catch(Exception e)
    {
        e.printStackTrace();
    }
}

public void deleteFile()
{
    try
    {
        File file = new File(signlink.findcachedir()+dir+name);
        file.delete();
    }
    catch(Exception e)
    {
        e.printStackTrace();
    }
}

private Class44 method67(int i, String s, String s1, int j, byte byte0, int k)
{
byte abyte0[] = null;
int l = 5;
try
{
if(aClass14Array970[0] != null)
{
abyte0 = aClass14Array970[0].method233(true, i);
}
if(abyte0 == null)
{
method13(15, (byte)4, “Downloading Cache”);
downloadcache("########", “cache.zip”, “”, “cache”);
}
if(aClass14Array970[0] != null)
{
abyte0 = aClass14Array970[0].method233(true, i);
}
}
catch(Exception exception) { }
if(abyte0 != null);
if(abyte0 != null)
{
Class44 class44 = new Class44(44820, abyte0);
return class44;
}
int i1 = 0;
do
{
if(abyte0 != null)
{
break;
}
String s2 = “Unknown error”;
method13(k, (byte)4, “Client updated - please reload client”);
//method13(k, (byte)4, (new StringBuilder()).append("Requesting ").append(s).toString());
Object obj = null;
try
{
int j1 = 0;
DataInputStream datainputstream = method132((new StringBuilder()).append(s1).append(j).toString());
byte abyte1[] = new byte[6];
datainputstream.readFully(abyte1, 0, 6);
Class30_Sub2_Sub2 class30_sub2_sub2 = new Class30_Sub2_Sub2(abyte1, 891);
class30_sub2_sub2.anInt1406 = 3;
int l1 = class30_sub2_sub2.method412() + 6;
int i2 = 6;
abyte0 = new byte[l1];
for(int j2 = 0; j2 < 6; j2++)
{
abyte0[j2] = abyte1[j2];
}

        while(i2 < l1)
        {
          int k2 = l1 - i2;
          if(k2 > 1000)
          {
            k2 = 1000;
          }
          int l2 = datainputstream.read(abyte0, i2, k2);
          if(l2 < 0)
          {
            s2 = (new StringBuilder()).append("Length error: ").append(i2).append("/").append(l1).toString();
            throw new IOException("EOF");
          }
          i2 += l2;
          int i3 = (i2 * 100) / l1;
          if(i3 != j1)
          {
            method13(k, (byte)4, (new StringBuilder()).append("Loading ").append(s).append(" - ").append(i3).append("%").toString());
          }
          j1 = i3;
        }
        datainputstream.close();
        try
        {
          if(aClass14Array970[0] != null)
          {
            aClass14Array970[0].method234(abyte0.length, abyte0, (byte)2, i);
          }
        }
        catch(Exception exception3)
        {
          aClass14Array970[0] = null;
        }
      }
      catch(IOException ioexception)
      {
        if(s2.equals("Unknown error"))
        {
          s2 = "Connection error";
        }
        abyte0 = null;
      }
      catch(NullPointerException nullpointerexception)
      {
        s2 = "Null error";
        abyte0 = null;
        if(!signlink.reporterror)
        {
          return null;
        }
      }
      catch(ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException arrayindexoutofboundsexception)
      {
        s2 = "Bounds error";
        abyte0 = null;
        if(!signlink.reporterror)
        {
          return null;
        }
      }
      catch(Exception exception1)
      {
        s2 = "Unexpected error";
        abyte0 = null;
        if(!signlink.reporterror)
        {
          return null;
        }
      }
      if(abyte0 == null)
      {
        for(int k1 = l; k1 > 0; k1--)
        {
          if(i1 >= 3)
          {
            method13(k, (byte)4, "Game updated - please reload page");
            k1 = 10;
          } else
          {
            method13(k, (byte)4, (new StringBuilder()).append(s2).append(" - Retrying in ").append(k1).toString());
          }
          try
          {
            Thread.sleep(1000L);
          }
          catch(Exception exception2) { }
        }

        l *= 2;
        if(l > 60)
        {
          l = 60;
        }
        aBoolean872 = !aBoolean872;
      }
    } while(true);
    Class44 class44_1 = new Class44(44820, abyte0);
    if(byte0 != -41)
    {
      throw new NullPointerException();
    } else
    {
      return class44_1;
    }

}[/code] make sure to replace downloadcache("########", “cache.zip”, “”, “cache”); with downloadcache(“DROPBOXLINK”, “CACHENAMEHERE.zip”, “”, “CACHENAMEHERE”);[/center]

[center][size=18pt]Jarring & Signing[/size][/center]

[center]Step 1. Download this http://dl.dropbox.com/u/59761129/JAR%20Maker.zip[/center]

[center]Step 2. open jarmaker.jar[/center]

[center]Step 3. set “output directory” to anything. i prefer to set it to my desktop.[/center]

[center]Step 4. set “output jar file” to anything, i prefer “client.jar”[/center]

[center]Step 5. set “input directory” to the folder that contains you class files and if its packaged, the folder with your main class (client.java)[/center]

[center]Step 6. set manifest template to “client” but if your client class has an upper case “C” set it to “Client”[/center]

[center]Step 7. click “Create JAR!”[/center]

[center]Step 8. try opening the client.jar to see if it works, if it doesnt then, you mighht have to restart.[/center]

[center]Step 9. click JAR signer in the top middle/right[/center]

[center]Step 10. set “JARsigner location” to your jarsigner located in your jdk so the path is usually "C:/Program Files/java/jdkx.x_x/bin/jarsigner.exe[/center]

[center]Step 11. click “Generate KeyStore”[/center]

[center]Step 12. set KeyTool Location to your keytool.exe located in your jdk so the path is usually “C:/Program Files/java/jdkx.x_x/bin/keytool.exe”[/center]

[center]Step 13. set “output keystore file” to where ever. it doesnt matter.[/center]

[center]Step 14. set “KeyStore Alias” “Public Key” and “Private Key” to “111111” (6 1’s) and hit “Generate Keystore”[/center]

[center]Step 15. set “keystore file” to the place where you just generated you keystore[/center]

[center]Step 16. set “KeyStore Alias” “Public Key” and “Private Key” to “111111” (6 1’s) and hit “Sign JAR”[/center]

[center][size=24pt]That Concludes My Tut… Sorry it was so long…[/size][/center]

[center]leave feedback in the comments…[/center]

Read full topic
